Informational.description: Explain the topic clearly so a non-expert can understand and feel confident. Priority: education, clarity, empathy.

voice_notes: Use simple, direct sentences with occasional longer lines for rhythm.
Sound like a patient expert explaining to a homeowner or small business owner.

allowed_phrases: Explore services that fit your situation.
Reach out if you’d like tailored advice.

intro_style.focus: context and explanation, not fear or pain.
openers: Many people aren’t sure where to start when they hear terms like this.
It often helps to see how this works in everyday situations.
A clear explanation can make decisions feel a lot less stressful.

rules: Focus on how/when/where rather than selling.
Mention target_location in at least 2 answers when provided.
Keep answers practical and concrete, no fluff.

Commercial.description: Help the reader compare options and feel confident choosing this provider. Priority: trust, benefits, differentiation.

voice_notes: Highlight outcomes and trust signals without hype.
Use real-feeling examples and scenarios instead of generic claims.
Balance expertise with empathy for budget and comfort concerns.

allowed_phrases: Talk with our team about what fits your home.
Plan your next upgrade with a specialist.
avoid_words: act now before it’s too late

intro_style.focus: benefits, clarity, and helping the reader avoid bad decisions.
openers: The right choice here can shape your comfort and costs for years.
Many homeowners only discover the differences after they’ve already installed a system.
A bit of guidance upfront can help you avoid expensive regrets later.

rules: Address real buying questions: reliability, warranty, service quality.
Mention target_location when explaining how service works locally.
Keep answers honest and realistic about timelines and expectations.

Transactional.description: Help the reader move quickly toward booking, pricing, or a quote while still feeling informed and safe.

voice_notes: Use clear language about next steps (quote, booking, inspection).
Emphasize speed, safety, and clarity on what happens after they contact you.
Avoid pressure; focus on removing friction and uncertainty.

allowed_phrases: Get a fast estimate for your home.
Book a visit that fits your schedule.
Request your quote and next steps.
avoid_words: act now before it’s too late

openers: If you’re ready to see real numbers and next steps, the process can be straightforward.
When comfort or safety is already at stake, waiting often makes the situation harder.
The sooner you understand your options and costs, the easier it is to decide.

rules: Answer questions about timelines, visit length, prep, and what’s included.
Mention target_location when talking about service coverage.
Keep answers clear and concise, avoiding jargon.

Navigational.description: Guide the reader to understand who this business is, where it operates, and how to contact or learn more.

voice_notes: Make it clear what the brand does and who it’s for.
Use friendly, professional language that builds trust quickly.

allowed_phrases: Contact our team in your area.
Call or email us to talk through your situation.
Visit our service pages to see what fits your property.
avoid_words: act now before it’s too late

intro_style.focus: brand clarity, service overview, and how to start.
openers: If you’re trying to confirm whether this team is the right fit, here’s how we work.
A quick look at who we are and how we help can make your next step easier.
This overview explains what we do, where we work, and how to reach us.

faq_style.tone: about the business and its processes
rules: Cover hours, areas served, response times, and contact options.
Mention target_location and other key cities in service_area if available.
